market_summary: XRP down 0.41% at $1.36 with $2.7B volume amid extreme fear (F&G: 8). ETF outflows continue at $2.6K daily pace while BTC and ETH ETFs show inflows.
thesis_pulse: Institutional foundation remains solid with 7 ETFs holding 790M XRP and RLUSD at $1.56B (31% of kill switch target). ETF outflows persist but slowing from previous weeks. Japan stress thesis under pressure from USD/JPY at 154.62 and JGB yields at 2.24%. PermissionedDEX live, ODL volume data gap remains critical blind spot. Core kill switches tracking but macro headwinds building.

stress_assessment.interpretation: Stress declining slightly from morning's 82 as USD/JPY holds below 155 threshold. JGB yields at 2.24% still above critical 2% level. Extreme fear environment (F&G: 8) with persistent ETF institutional retreat signals.

alerts.message: XRPL metrics fetch failing - ledger data unavailable for infrastructure monitoring
ETF outflows slowing to $2.6K daily vs prior week's $33K average

etf_analysis: Outflows persist at $2.6K daily but significantly slower than prior week's $33K pace. Total AUM stable at $1.1B with 790M XRP locked (1.3% of supply).
macro_analysis: USD/JPY at 154.62 holds below 155 stress threshold but JGB yields at 2.24% maintain pressure above critical 2% level. Brent at $69.77 below stress thresholds.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: JGB yields 2.24% above critical threshold, yen at 154.62 approaching stress level amid Takaichi supermajority pressure.
Dual carrier presence in Hormuz maintains critical escalation risk with Russia-Iran-China exercises ongoing.
Section 122 tariff clock running with ~145 days remaining before July expiration.
10% global tariffs active under Section 122 authority following SCOTUS IEEPA strike, expires mid-July.
Russia-Iran-China joint exercises in Hormuz escalate regional military coordination signals.

energy_interpretation: Brent at $69.77 remains below stress thresholds but Hormuz dual carrier deployment maintains supply disruption risk. Japan import dependency creates direct feedback loop: oil price spikes → trade deficit expansion → yen weakness → JGB yield pressure → BOJ credibility crisis. Current energy stability provides temporary relief but geopolitical risks remain elevated.
thesis_pulse_assessment: Core institutional infrastructure solidifying with 790M XRP in ETFs and RLUSD at $1.56B. PermissionedDEX live, major integrations advancing. ETF outflows slowing signals institutional retreat stabilizing. Japan stress thesis active with JGB yields at 2.24% and yen near 155 threshold. ODL volume data gap remains critical oversight blind spot. Foundation strong but macro headwinds building.
stress_interpretation: Composite stress at 78 (down from 82) as USD/JPY holds below 155 critical threshold at 154.62. JGB yields at 2.24% maintain pressure above 2% critical level. Extreme fear environment (F&G: 8) signals broad institutional risk-off sentiment continuing.

bear_case.score_reasoning: Counter-thesis pressure increasing from persistent ETF outflows and extreme fear environment, partially offset by slowing outflow pace and stable institutional foundation.

BIS Project Nexus remains credible bypass threat to XRPL settlement utility. ODL volume data gap prevents validation of core utility thesis momentum while JGB stress builds systemic risk.
